channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [BOOKKEEPER-675] Log noise fixup before cutting 4.2.2
item.description:
The message isn't a warning, but an information message that tells you that you initiated your cluster before instance ids existed, as such it should be info level so it doesn't show up on monitoring systems.

WARN org.apache.bookkeeper.bookie.Bookie - INSTANCEID not exists in
zookeeper. Not considering it for data verification

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: since instanceid is used for data integrity guarantee, I don't think it is a good idea to change it to info. maybe we could consider how to upgrade an old system to provide instanceid.

Sijie Guo But it's ok if it's not there. The problem is if it's different. Not being there means an old cluster. Being different means corruption. INFO logs are enabled by default anyhow, so it will show up in the logs. It just wont trigger monitoring systems.
Broadening the jira to include other logging issues I've seen
Patch is mostly lowering stuff to debug if its redundant or too noisy to be of any use. There's a couple fixes to avoid RejectedExecutionException also.

Added another log statement so it's clear when journal replay finishes.

Some comments:

  1. Please create a jira for the TODO in the patch;
  2. This change "+ channels.clear();" seems to be unrelated to this patch;
  3. You have changed some error messages to debug, like those in PerChannelBookieClient. They seem to represent some error condition or at least an error condition in a bookie. As such, they might impact the execution of the client and I would think that the severity level should be at least WARN.

Please create a jira for the TODO in the patch;

Will do

This change "+ channels.clear();" seems to be unrelated to this patch;

If channels isn't cleared after all channels are closed, the bookie watcher will try to close them when it looses all bookies (when zkclient goes down). The executor may be shutdown by that point, so this spams the logs with junk.


You have changed some error messages to debug, like those in PerChannelBookieClient. They seem to represent some error condition or at least an error condition in a bookie. As such, they might impact the execution of the client and I would think that the severity level should be at least WARN.

In production logs, these messages are almost meaningless, and they spam the logs. Lets say you're writing at 300 requests per second and a bookie dies. It takes 5 seconds to detect. Thats 1500 log messages. And what do they tell you? That a bookie died. Not that a write failed. You have many other less spammy means to detect bookie death. It this shouldn't affect the client. The client is built to withstand such failures. So really you've written 1500 WARN log messages, and possibly woken up the service engineer for nothing. In practice, messages like this just get put on an exclude list. If the write of the entry fails to write to quorum we should log it. But then we should only log the first entry to fail for that ledger, as I've done in the patch, and only when it fails completely, not just to one replica.
+1 for the patch from my perspective. but still need review from fpj. since he was involved in this thread.

If the log message is not fulfilling its role, then we are possibly not doing logging right in that part of the code. I don't think it is a big deal and it certainly doesn't make sense to hold 4.2.2 because of this issue. +1, ship it.

Committed r1521667 to trunk.
Committed r1521624 to branch-4.2

SUCCESS: Integrated in bookkeeper-trunk #357 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/bookkeeper-trunk/357/)
